author: @Christina Harrold
title: Cillian Murphy shares honest reaction to being called ‚ÄòInternet‚Äôs boyfriend‚Äô
text: Cillian Murphy has recently shared her honest reaction to him being called the ‚ÄúInternet‚Äôs boyfriend‚Äù. Speaking to Entertainment Tonight at the 35th Annual Palm Springs International Film Festival Awards Gala earlier this week, the Oppenheimer star was stunned to have his newfound status online. ‚ÄúI don't know about too many things internet-wise, but it's lovely. It's very flattering. Very flattered,‚Äù said Cillian. Earlier, Cillian fans took to X, formerly known as Twitter, and appreciated the actor, with one wrote, ‚ÄúCillian murphy is boyfriend material.‚Äù ‚ÄúI want Oppenheimer to be good for my boyfriend Cillian Murphy‚Äôs sake,‚Äù remarked another user. A third said, ‚ÄúCillian is so husband/boyfriend i can‚Äôt believe he's the same age as my mum.‚Äù ‚ÄúCillian murphy is my husband my wife my boyfriend my girlfriend he‚Äôs my everything,‚Äù state the fourth user. ‚ÄúMy media teacher started referring to Cillian Murphy as ‚Äòyour boyfriend‚Äô as he should though honestly.‚Äù Someone mentioned, ‚ÄúOh hey now that Cillian Murphy's the internet's boyfriend, how about we all (re)watch Anthropoid?‚Äù ‚ÄúNever in my life did i think Cillian murphy would become the internet‚Äôs boyfriend of the month but here we are and i‚Äôm enjoying it,‚Äù added another user. In December, Cillian admitted to Margot Robbie in Variety‚Äôs Actors on Actors interview. ‚ÄúI have two teenage boys. I do know what a meme is. Now I know that there are memes about me not knowing what a meme is,‚Äù he added. On January 4, the New York Times published a story questioning Swift's sexuality Kate married Derek in 2005 Jacob Elordi discusses about Saltburn movie with co-star Barry Keoghan in a new interview Julianne Hough joined the cast of ABC's Dancing with the Stars in 2007 Prince Andrew faced another blow after further documents regarding Jeffrey Epstein were released to the public Jodie Foster slams Gen Z over their work culture in a publication interview

author: Importer
title: SNOW Investors Have Opportunity to Lead Snowflake Inc. Securities Fraud Lawsuit | finanzen.net
text:
Home Aktien Snowflake Aktie News zu Snowflake SNOW Investors Have Opportunity to Lead Snowflake Inc. Securities Fraud Lawsuit Tradespot by finanzen.net - Dein neuer Begleiter auf dem Weg zur besten Trading-Idee. Jetzt handeln! SNOW Investors Have Opportunity to Lead Snowflake Inc. Securities Fraud Lawsuit 25.04.24 22:42 Uhr Werbung Werte in diesem Artikel Aktien Snowflake 142,58 EUR 0,76 EUR 0,54% Charts | News | Analysen Aktie kaufen
LOS ANGELES , April 25, 2024 /PRNewswire/ -- The Law Offices of Frank R. Cruz announces that investors with substantial losses have opportunity to lead the securities fraud class action lawsuit against Snowflake Inc. ("Snowflake" or the "Company") (NYSE: SNOW ).
Class Period: September 16, 2020 ‚Äì March 2, 2022
Lead Plaintiff Deadline: April 29, 2024
If you are a shareholder who suffered a loss, click here to participate.
The complaint filed alleges that, throughout the Class Period, Defendants failed to disclose to investors: (1) that Snowflake had systematically oversold capacity to customers which created a misleading appearance of the demand for Snowflake's products and services; (2) that Snowflake had provided significant discounts to its customers prior to the IPO that temporarily boosted sales but would not be sustainable after the IPO and/or necessitate platform efficiency adjustments that negatively impacted client consumption and Snowflake's revenue and profit margins; (3) that, as a result, Snowflake's customers were poised to roll over a material amount of unused credits (and thereby cannibalize future sales) at the end of their contracts' terms or to refuse to renew their contracts at prior consumption levels or at all; (4) that, as a result, Snowflake's product revenue and remaining performance obligations had been artificially inflated leading up to and during the Class Period; and (5) as a result, Defendants' positive statements about the Company's business, operations, and prospects were materially misleading and/or lacked a reasonable basis at all relevant times.
Follow us for updates on Twitter: twitter.com/FRC_LAW .
To be a member of the class action you need not take any action at this time; you may retain counsel of your choice or take no action and remain an absent member of the class action. If you wish to learn more about this class action, or if you have any questions concerning this announcement or your rights or interests with respect to the pending class action lawsuit, please contact Frank R. Cruz , of The Law Offices of Frank R. Cruz , 2121 Avenue of the Stars, Suite 800, Century City, California 90067 at 310-914-5007, by email to info@frankcruzlaw.com , or visit our website at www.frankcruzlaw.com . If you inquire by email please include your mailing address, telephone number, and number of shares purchased.
This press release may be considered Attorney Advertising in some jurisdictions under the applicable law and ethical rules.
View original content: https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/snow-investors-have-opportunity-to-lead-snowflake-inc-securities-fraud-lawsuit-302127846.html
SOURCE The Law Offices of Frank R. Cruz , Los Angeles

author: Alberto Iglesias Fraga
title: Cuando patentar mucho es malo... y otras historias de terror innovador
text:
Durante d√©cadas, las autodenominadas voces autorizadas del sector innovador han venido criticando que a los cient√≠ficos se les midiera casi en exclusiva por el n√∫mero de publicaciones realizadas, minusvalorando otros par√°metros que -a su juicio- constataban mejor el rendimiento innovador, como las patentes. Patentes a bulto, patentes como sin√≥nimo de cerrar el ciclo de la I+D+I, patentes como at√©rida quimera en un indolente empecinamiento en valorar la cantidad por encima de la calidad.
¬°Patentes por doquier! ¬°Vivan las patentes!
Vaya por delante la complejidad de establecer objetivos y medidas sobre criterios cualitativos sobre los cuantitativos . Para un gestor de fondos p√∫blicos, juzgar sobre una base num√©rica es representaci√≥n de justicia, hacerlo sobre un criterio casi personal es lo m√°s cercano a la prevaricaci√≥n que existe. Para los medios que cubrimos estos asuntos, es m√°s f√°cil hablar de datos que jug√°rsela a valorar la pertinencia o no de una idea. Y es que saber si un investigador patenta m√°s que su colega es realmente sencillo ; determinar cu√°l de las dos patentes goza de un mayor valor es bastante m√°s dif√≠cil
No ser√≠a,de hecho, la primera vez que una patente sin pena ni gloria acaba siendo la base de una industria multimillonaria. En 1989, unos investigadores del CSIC (Javier Border√≠as Ju√°rez y Margarita Tejada Yabar) cogieron pescados de descarte y patentaron su "procedimiento de fabricaci√≥n de un producto an√°logo a la angula y producto as√≠ obtenido". Desde que la compa√±√≠a Angulas Aguinaga pusiera las primeras gulas del norte a la venta en 1991, √©sta ha sido una de las patentes espa√±olas m√°s rentables de todos los tiempos.
En cualquier caso, creo que la reducci√≥n al absurdo que he empleado al comienzo de este an√°lisis es lo suficientemente cristalina como para darnos cuenta de que este tipo de aproximaciones, basadas s√≥lo en la cantidad, son rid√≠culas, innecesarias y carentes de valor. El prestigio que se asigna a aquellos que patentan mucho deber√≠a ser parejo al de aquellos que publican muchos papers : existen muchas formas de engordar los n√∫meros, de sumar y sumar registros sin que ninguno de ellos tenga el m√°s m√≠nimo impacto.
El caso real del Estados Unidos de finales de los 90 es la mejor prueba de esta premisa. Durante esa d√©cada, aument√≥ un 64% el n√∫mero de patentes registradas, pero la creatividad de las mismas cay√≥ un 27% y el crecimiento de la productividad hizo lo propio un 30%. En otras palabras: a pesar de batir r√©cord de patentes, la innovaci√≥n no derrib√≥ ninguna barrera inusitada, no fue disruptiva, sino evolutiva.
Estas cifras, analizadas en un paper de Aakash Kalyani, del Banco de la Reserva Federal, apuntan a la ca√≠da del crecimiento demogr√°fico como causa √∫ltima del descenso en cuanto a patentes creativas y el aumento de las derivadas. Los investigadores m√°s noveles, asegura el autor, tienden a registrar ideas m√°s rompedoras, mientras que los inventores veteranos optan por presentar m√°s patentes derivadas. O lo que es lo mismo: imitaciones end√≥genas de tecnolog√≠as, como reza el estudio.
Espa√±a ocupa tradicionalmente puestos al final del 'top 10' en t√©rminos de solicitudes de patentes entre los pa√≠ses europeos. Pero lo m√°s importante es que la contribuci√≥n de las industrias intensivas en patentes es considerablemente menor que en todos nuestros vecinos, en torno al 8% del empleo y el 11,5% del PIB (EUIPO EPO 2022).
La labor en este campo de la secretaria general Teresa Riesgo, el actual secretario de Estado Juan Cruz Cigudosa y la ministra Diana Morant ha sido encomiable. La propia Morant se emocionaba al hablar, en la entrevista que mantuvimos en 2022 , sobre romper con la tiran√≠a del paper y promocionar las patentes en nuestro pa√≠s gracias a la nueva Ley de Ciencia y las pol√≠ticas de transferencia de conocimiento impulsadas por su gabinete. Misi√≥n noble y necesaria, pero sin olvidarnos de que aumentar la calidad puede llevarnos a cambiar una historia de terror innovador por otra...
NEWSLETTER - DISRUPTORES Las claves digitales de la semana todos los viernes en tu buz√≥n Apuntarme De conformidad con el RGPD y la LOPDGDD, EL LE√ìN DE EL ESPA√ëOL PUBLICACIONES, S.A. tratar√° los datos facilitados con la finalidad de remitirle noticias de actualidad.

author: Judy Black
title: MLGW truck stolen in East Memphis, MPD says | localmemphis.com
text:
MEMPHIS, Tenn. ‚Äî According to the Memphis Police Department (MPD), a man stole an MLGW truck in East Memphis on Thursday.
Around noon, officers said they responded to a call on the 4900 block of Briarcliff Rd.
An MLGW technician told police that he was working a water meter, and his truck was parked but still running, powering the water pump that was plugged into the front of it, police said.
The technician said a man then got into the truck and began driving it westbound on Briarcliff. He said the man was wearing a black toboggan, according to MPD.
The truck contained a laptop, radio and equipment, and it is altogether valued at around $75,000, police said.
According to MPD, MLGW personnel were able to track the radio in the truck, and its last known location was in the area of 83 S Highland St. Later, the radio went offline, police said.
Memphis Police have been unable to find the stolen truck and have no additional information about the suspect.
Related Articles Person dies after going down embankment and crashing Burglars break into GameStop in Midtown, steal PS5

author: doapp, inc.
title: Inmate found unresponsive in Linn County Jail dies
text:
The Gazette offers audio versions of articles using Instaread. Some words may be mispronounced.
CEDAR RAPIDS ‚Äî After being found unresponsive and without a pulse, a male inmate at the Linn County Jail died Thursday despite attempts to save him, according to the Linn County Sheriff‚Äôs Office.
The inmate, who ‚Äúhad an extensive medical history and was serving time on several charges‚Äù since Dec. 7, according to the Sheriff‚Äôs Office, was not identified until notification of relatives.
According to a news release, jail staff about 3:54 p.m. Thursday discovered the inmate unconscious in a cell. The news release didn‚Äôt say how long it had been since he was last checked on before being found or whether other inmates were present in the cellblock at the time.
A medical emergency was declared over the jail‚Äôs radios and nurses and additional staff responded to the cellblock. Staff began CPR and connected the inmate to an automated external defibrillator. Additional paramedics responded to help, the Sheriff‚Äôs Office said.
The Linn County Medical Examiner‚Äôs Office ordered an autopsy to help determine his cause of death, authorities said. The death was reported to the State Jail Inspector and the incident is under investigation, according to the Sheriff‚Äôs Office.

author: Ask a Manager
title: man at our events monopolizes attendees, beverages on video calls, and more
text: It‚Äôs four answers to four questions. Here we go‚Ä¶ 1. A man at our events makes other attendees uncomfortable I‚Äôm on a planning committee for an event involving a fandom generally beloved by mostly women, often mothers and daughters. This event is spread over a few days and involves speakers, tours of book/filming sites, etc. There‚Äôs a middle-aged man, Alex, who is a fan and has attended previous in person and virtual events (where I was not on the planning committee). Alex is passionate about this IP, which is great, but he tends to monopolize the attention of a few of the attendees. When one would gently but firmly say, ‚ÄúI‚Äôd like to stop talking now and enjoy the tour, Alex,‚Äù he would move to another and so on. Additionally, at past events, the committee has gotten verbal and written feedback that Alex made some people uncomfortable, mainly by approaching their daughters to talk about this IP and other similar ones. Absolutely nothing untoward happened and all the children were with their mothers, but the girls involved didn‚Äôt wish to engage in conversation and their mothers had a hard time ending the conversations with Alex. Alex was also removed from a social media group for this IP, for continuing to call and text a member, Joyce, after she asked him not to, and then mailing things to her home as apologies for upsetting her. This social media group isn‚Äôt officially part of the event, but Joyce will be there as a speaker. Alex has attended other, virtual events since then and has behaved appropriately and not interacted with Joyce. Alex is neurodivergent, and his difficulties with communication, social cues, and rejection are absolutely part of his disability. It‚Äôs worth noting that while he clearly has higher support needs in terms of interpersonal skills, he has low support needs in his high-level career. The other planning committee members and I are struggling to figure out how to best handle this. We want Alex to be able to have a good time without impeding on other attendees‚Äô boundaries. (As an aside, I only mention Alex‚Äôs neurodivergence as background that he processes the world differently than neurotypical adults. We have other neurodivergent folks attending and on the planning committee, and we‚Äôre trying to be as inclusive as we can.) Past committees chose to rotate time buddying up with him to try and smooth these experiences, but that‚Äôs not something this committee is able to do. Should we quietly look for volunteers to keep Alex company? That might be our solution, but it also feels like we‚Äôd be imposing on people who are paying for this event to ask them to give up their focus on the event to engage Alex. Are we able to request that he only attend virtually instead of in person? I‚Äôd love any advice on how to proceed with being sensitive, respectful, and maintaining everyone‚Äôs boundaries while not being infantilizing or rude to Alex. Can you just be straightforward with Alex? ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre looking forward to seeing you at X! We want to share some feedback from previous events to help ensure everyone has a good experience. At previous events, some attendees felt you crossed boundaries by approaching kids who didn‚Äôt want to talk with an adult they didn‚Äôt know and by keeping people in conversation when they wanted to focus on the event. We are happy to welcome you back this year but ask that you not approach kids you don‚Äôt know, and be mindful that while adult attendees may enjoy a brief (five minutes or so) chat, most will prefer to return their focus to the event. We look forward to seeing you and hope you have a great time.‚Äù It might sting, but it‚Äôs kinder to clearly spell out what he needs to do if he wants to be welcomed back in the future. You also have the option of asking him to only attend virtually, but you could give this a try first and see if it solves the problem. Related: telling a member that his behavior at our events is ruining it for everyone else 2. Acceptable beverages on video calls I have a very low stakes question that I find myself overthinking in a new role. What are the generally accepted beverages and/or containers to drink out of on calls? I would assume water bottles are fine, coffee mugs, coffee tumblers, etc., but I recently found myself thinking about things like cans of kombucha that might look like beer, a green juice with a straw, soda, that kind of thing. My job is casual enough that it definitely doesn‚Äôt matter internally, but there‚Äôs something about seeing myself using a straw on camera that makes me feel like a toddler. If it looks like beer, pour it in non-clear glass. Otherwise, any of those are fine, including straws! (Assuming it‚Äôs a standard straw and not, like, a Krazy Straw.) The exception is if the meeting or your industry requires an especially high degree of polish. For example, I wouldn‚Äôt bring a soda can with a straw to a meeting with a VIP client for the first time ‚Äî although it‚Äôs hard to defend why and, like so many things, it‚Äôs about cultural connotations around those items rather than any real reason. Related: does it look unprofessional to have an energy drink at my desk every day? 3. Management scheduled a team-building workshop to fix our bad manager I‚Äôm part of a small team in a government agency. The team lead is my skip-level boss, Julie. Our team and our larger agency have gone through a bit of turmoil and employee tension in the past few years. There were a lot of factors, both in and out of our control, that contributed, but the main one was Julie. She has poor communication skills, is disorganized, and doesn‚Äôt seem to understand much of the work we do but refuses to admit it. This is especially a problem because our team is responsible for making sure the agency is in compliance with certain laws, so we are breaking the law if we don‚Äôt do our jobs correctly. For years, upper management has ignored the problems with Julie, until this year when one of my coworkers reported the lack of compliance to the appropriate authorities. Upper management is now showing some interest in addressing the situation by asking us to attend a three-day-long workshop to ‚Äúrebuild our working relationships.‚Äù We all anticipate that this will be a long and awkward ‚Äúteam-building‚Äù event that will do absolutely nothing to address the serious management issues we‚Äôre having, but will make our lives harder by interrupting our actual work. Is it worth going to upper management as a team and telling them that we don‚Äôt think this workshop is a good use of our time, and that they should focus their energy on actually managing Julie? I don‚Äôt personally have a lot of confidence that management will actually listen to us. You can try. The problem, of course, is that the same incompetence (and/or lack of care) that has allowed them to bury their heads in the sand about Julie up until now is the same incompetence that now makes them think a workshop on ‚Äúrebuilding relationships‚Äù will somehow address it. Either they‚Äôre truly inept enough to think that‚Äôs an appropriate response, or they don‚Äôt actually care about resolving the issues and just want to be able to say they‚Äôve done something. (However, this such a ludicrously bad attempt at ‚Äúsomething‚Äù and so unlikely to fly with anyone exercising any real oversight that I‚Äôve got to think incompetence is at least one of the factors in play.) That said, it sounds like they were moved to action after the initial report, so it‚Äôs possible that applying additional pressure will move them a little more. So I say give it a try; tell them you‚Äôre happy they want to address the problems, but the workshop has nothing to do with what the issues are. Just keep your hopes low. 4. Porn Hub sticker on laptop I work at a community college. One of my colleagues has a student in her class with a Porn Hub sticker on her laptop. We‚Äôre just curious if and how you would address this with a student? In college? I‚Äôd leave it alone. If she doesn‚Äôt have the sense to realize not to do that once she‚Äôs at work, she‚Äôll be informed pretty quickly. This assumes the sticker is just words and not, say, an X-rated photo. If it were that, you‚Äôd need to tell her to stop exposing unconsenting classmates to it. You may also like:how to say "stop following me" at an eventcan I tell interviewers my hobby is drinking, going from scruffy to polished at work, and moreI don't want to be pied in the face for work { 740 comments }

author: Henry Wolff
title: Karma Strikes Down Financially Successful Immigrant Who Bragged About Scoring Free Groceries From Food Banks
text: [Karma Strikes Down Financially Successful Immigrant Who Bragged About Scoring Free Groceries From Food Banks](https://revolver.news/2024/04/karma-strikes-down-financially-successful-immigrant-who-bragged-about-scoring-free-groceries-from-food-banks/) Revolver, April 25, 2024 An Indian immigrant from Canada got a quick dose of karma after he went online and bragged about how he feeds himself by raiding food pantries meant to help the needy. This man reportedly worked as a data scientist with TD Bank and supposedly earned nearly $100,000 annually. Even though he‚Äôs successful and well off, he prefers to get all his groceries for free from a food bank for needy people. {snip} The video he made, where he bragged about pretending to be a struggling student to score freebies, went mega-viral for all the wrong reasons. this guy has a job as a bank data scientist for [@TD_Canada], a position that averages $98,000 per year, and proudly uploaded this video showing how much ‚Äúfree food‚Äù he gets from charity food banks. you don‚Äôt hate them enough. [pic.twitter.com/mUIGQnlYu6] ‚Äî pagliacci the hated üåù (@Slatzism) [April 20, 2024] Meet Mehul Prajapati, recently, he decided to show people online how they can steal food from foodbanks by pretending to be students at WLU and UofW. Mr Prajapati is a recent immigrant to Canada who was revealed to have a six-figure job at TD bank (which he was fired from). This is only the tip of the iceberg, as food bank abuse by immigrants and international students had become a particularly serious problem in many college communities. 75% of international students have used a food bank in the last year alone. (Meal Exchange 2021 report) Keep in mind, these very same students are legally required to show proof of adequate financial support in order to retain their student visas. This is the last demographic who should be utilizing food bank services! {snip} It turns out that this is a growing problem in Canada, where international students, especially Indians, are stealing food from the needy. {snip} {snip} After the video he made went viral, he reportedly lost his lucrative job. An Indian-origin data scientist working at TD Bank in Canada was fired after he shared a video detailing how he obtained ‚Äúfree food‚Äù from food banks meant for students. He had boasted in the video that he saved ‚Äúhundreds of bucks‚Äù every month by exploiting the food banks. The man, identified as Mehul Prajapati, was employed by TD Bank. It took action after people criticised him on social media. In a video shared on social media, Prajapati explained how he got free groceries from food banks on college and university campuses. Food banks in Canada are run by charities and provide essential food items to people in need. They are typically used by low-income families or students facing financial difficulties. Prajapati claimed in the video that he saved ‚Äúhundreds of bucks‚Äù each month on groceries by using the food banks. {snip}

author: Forbes / EP
title: UGT y CCOO urgen a agilizar los trabajos para proteger la seguridad y la salud de los trabajadores
text:
MADRID, 7 (EUROPA PRESS)
La Uni√≥n General de Trabajadores (UGT) y Comisiones Obreras (UGT)han urgido este jueves a agilizar los trabajas en la mesa de di√°logo social en materia de seguridad y salud en el trabajo que comenz√≥ sus trabajos hace ya un a√±o y medio ¬´sin que todav√≠a est√© rindiendo frutos¬ª.
¬´Es escandaloso que mueran 363 personas trabajadoras en seis meses por el simple hecho de intentar ganarse la vida, son tres m√°s que las registradas en el primer semestre de 2024¬ª, ha advertido el sindicato UGT en un comunicado, tras conocerse las cifras del Ministerio de Trabajo.
En este sentido, desde Comisiones Obreras consideran que hay un amplio margen para mejorar las cifras de la siniestralidad en Espa√±a, pero para ello creen que es necesario que se produzcan modificaciones legislativas y avances en las pol√≠ticas p√∫blicas, que todav√≠a est√°n pendientes de un acuerdo en la mesa de di√°logo social en materia de seguridad y salud en el trabajo que comenz√≥ sus trabajos hace ya un a√±o y medio ¬´sin que todav√≠a est√© rindiendo frutos¬ª.
En esta l√≠nea, UGT cree necesario y urgente actualizar la ley de prevenci√≥n a las nuevas realidades del mundo del trabajo, fuertemente influido por las transiciones demogr√°fica, clim√°tica y digital.
Igualmente, el sindicato cree que debe reforzarse la protecci√≥n de la salud mental de la clase trabajadora, ya que en seis meses se han producido 126 accidentes de trabajo mortales por infartos y derrames cerebrales, ¬´lo que podr√≠a estar relacionado con la exposici√≥n a riesgos psicosociales y organizativos¬ª.
¬´Nos reiteramos en nuestra demanda para que los trabajos en la mesa de Di√°logo Social se agilicen buscando garantizar la protecci√≥n de la seguridad y salud de las personas trabajadoras¬ª, ha recalcado el sindicato.
